intro: Echium ovatum, commonly known as the common thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its distinctive seed pods, which resemble tiny thimbles, are a notable botanical feature. Echium ovatum is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
